title: When Companies Fire Their Auditors, Timing Is Clue to Future Trouble
sub_head: Study shows that when auditors are fired late in the year, accounting problems are more likely
body:
When a company and its auditor split up, it can be a sign of trouble in the books. But the two sides typically donâ€™t give a reason for the breakup.
Two accounting professors instead looked at the timing of the split. They found that the later in the year it occurs, the more worried investors should be.
